page.title: 11ROAD TRANSPORT IN THE AREA
page.content: THE WARWICK HIGHWAY IS A{'B' ROAD THAT IS VERY BUSY, IT COMES FROM HENLEY AND LINKS WARWICK WITH REDDITCH WHERE IT BECOMES A DUAL CARRIAGEWAY. THE BIRMINGHAM ROAD IS A MAIN{'A' {ROAD.}IT LINKS REDDITCH AND BIRMINGHAM WITH CHELTENHAM FOLLOWING THE OLD ROUTE OF THE ROMAN ROAD, ICKNIELD STREET. MOST OF THE TRAFFIC ON THESE ROADS IS CARS,VANS,LORRIES AND MOTORBIKES. IN THIS AREA THE ROADS ARE MAINLY {COUNTRY LANES AND SINGLE TRACK ROADS WHICH CAN GET VERY NARROW. THEY LINK UP SMALL HABITATIONS, FARMS,HOUSES, AND SETTLEMENTS. THE TRAFFIC IS MAINLY CARS AND FARM VEHICLES AND MACHINERY SOME PEOPLE USE THE COUNTRY LANES AND ROADS TO AVOID THE CONGESTED HIGHWAYS DURING THE HOURS OF MUCH TRAFFIC.
